page.topic: Displaying Calculated Values on a FormView
page.description: When you design a FormView control you may want the form to display calculated values (typically computed from other fields in the form). Since the Form is really just an HTML template that is rendered using Alpha Anywhere's client-side templating features, this is easily done.

section.description: For more on displaying calculated values on a formview watch [this video] (Date added: 2016-10-10) or follow the guide below.

section.title: Create a List Control with a Computed Column

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Data Controls' menu. Click on the [List] option to add a List control to the component.
Highlight the list control. In the properties section on the right click on the [...] button next to the 'List properties' property in the 'List Properties' section. The List Builder will open.
Open the List Builder's 'Data Source' pane. From the 'Data Source Type' menu select the 'Static' option.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Static data' property in the 'Static Data' section.
Click the 'Sample data' button at the bottom of the Static Choices dialog.
Select the 'Name and addresses' option in the Sample Data dialog and click OK.
Add 'Price', 'Qty', and 'Total' fields to the data by added the field names to the first row of data. Separate each field with a pipe '|' character.
Open the Fields pane. Highlight the 'Price' field.
In the properties list on the right set the 'Transform data type' dropdown to the 'ToNumber' setting. This property is in the 'Client-side' section.
Highlight the 'Qty' field. Set the 'Transform data type' for the 'Qty' field to 'ToNumber'.
Highlight the 'Total' field and set thiis field's' 'Transform data type' property to 'ToNumber'.
Open the 'List Properties' pane. Scroll down the properties list to the 'Computed Columns' section. Click the [...] button next to the 'Computed columns' property.
Create the following expression to defined the value of the 'Total' field. Click OK.
Open the 'List Layout' pane. Use the blue '>' arrow to move all of the data fields from the 'Available Fields' list into the 'Columns in List'. Click OK to close the List Builder

section.title: Display Calculated Values in a FormView

step.description: Open the 'Other Controls' menu on the UX Controls page. Click on the [Form View] option to add Form View control under the list control.
Highlight the Form View control. In the properties list on the right click the [...] button next to the 'Form properties' property to open the Form View Builder.
On the Form View Builder's 'Data Source' pane. Set the 'Datasource type' property to 'List'.
Click the [...] button next to the 'List name' property and select the list control you defined, 'list1'.
Open the Form Layout pane and click the 'Add item' button in the lower left.

Highlight the 'Data Controls' option in the category menu and the [Label] option in the 'Control' menu. In the list of fields on the right highlight the 'Firstname', 'Lastname', 'City', 'State', 'Price', and 'Qty' fields. Do not highlight the 'Total' field. Click OK.
Highlight all of the [Label] items and click on the 'Add item' button again.
In the Category menu select the 'Containers' option. In the Control menu select [LayoutContainer] and click the 'Insert Around' option.
Highlight the [LayoutContainer End: LAYOUTCONTAINER_1] tag. Click the 'Add item' button again.
